FuncDef:
The duration command specifies the period of a configuration test and a performance test.
The undo duration command restores the default period of a configuration test and a performance test.
By default, the period for a configuration test is 3 seconds, and the period of a performance test is 15 minutes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the time that a configuration test takes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 60, in seconds.

Specifies the time that a performance test takes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1440, in minutes.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An Ethernet service activation test consists of configuration tests and performance tests. To specify the time a configuration test takes, run the duration configuration-test command. To specify the time a performance test takes, run the duration performance-test command.
Precautions
The configuration test period consists of times that all tests take. The tests include a 25% CIR test, a 50% CIR test, and an EIR test. The performance test period is the total time that a performance test takes.
